Class KeyStatistics

Encapsulates statistical information about the number of keys in existence for a given index.

Inheritance
System.Object
KeyStatistics
Implements
System.IDisposable

Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public sealed class KeyStatistics : IDisposable
Remarks

Statistics are available for the total number of keys currently in use by the index, as well as the total number of unique keys in use by the index. Use IndexedKeys and UniqueKeys, respectively, to retrieve these values.

Be aware that the number the number of keys maintained for an index is a function of the number and size of documents stored in the container, and of the type of index being examined.

KeyStatistics objects are instantiated by LookupStatistics(String, String, String, String, String, XmlValue).

Property Value
Type Description
System.Double

The size of the key value for the reported index.
View Source

UniqueKeys

Gets the number of unique keys contained in the index for which statistics are being reported. There are likely to be many more keys than unique keys in the index because a given key can appear multiple times, once for each document feature on each document that it is referencing.

Declaration
public double UniqueKeys { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Double

The total unique key count for the reported index.

Dispose(Boolean)

Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

Declaration
protected void Dispose(bool disposing)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean disposing

If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
